attributes.description:
Controls how wide the currency symbol appears in currency input fields (like the '$' symbol that appears inside the input box). This determines the space reserved for the currency symbol.
CSS variable: --wm-currency-inputgroup-addon-width

Sets the typeface (font style) for currency symbols in input fields. This determines whether the currency symbol appears in Arial, Times New Roman, or other font styles.
CSS variable: --wm-currency-inputgroup-addon-font-family

Controls how large the currency symbol appears in input fields. This affects the size of the '$', 'â‚¬', or other currency symbols that users see inside the input box.
CSS variable: --wm-currency-inputgroup-addon-font-size

Controls how thick or bold the currency symbol appears in input fields. 'normal' makes it regular weight, 'bold' makes it thicker, and numbers (100-900) provide fine control over thickness.
CSS variable: --wm-currency-inputgroup-addon-font-weight

Controls the vertical spacing around currency symbols in input fields. This ensures the symbol is properly centered within the input field.
CSS variable: --wm-currency-inputgroup-addon-line-height

Controls the horizontal spacing around currency symbols in input fields. This can help make the symbol more readable and properly spaced.
CSS variable: --wm-currency-inputgroup-addon-letter-spacing
